intro: Pavonia guerkeana, commonly known as the Guerke's wood rose, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks. Pavonia guerkeana has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds.
